availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Fabricius C. McCalla (cashier at Farmers Bank)

body.p: Born in Kentucky, McCalla was the postmaster at Stamping Ground, Kentucky from 1834-1840. He was a cashier at Farmers Bank as of 1860 and served as a trustee of Georgetown College. McCalla died in Scott County, Kentucky.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, [Kentucky], [Scott], [Georgetown], p. 13; Find A Grave, “Fabricius C. McCalla (July 7, 1807-April 16, 1873),” Memorial #75724530, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=75724530 (accessed June 3, 2017).
